page.title: 09FARMING-MORDIFORD AREA
page.content: The area consists of a flood plain surrounded by an upland area known as the Woolhope Dome. The average size of farm is around 44 hectares.In the past this average was much lower at around 22 hectares,but recently many farms have been bought & consolidated into larger units. Although wheat & barley are grown on the flood plain,the farmers main source of income is from livestock.The main types of livestock kept are sheep, beef-cattle & some pigs. Hay is grown for fodder but is supplimented by "bought in" compounds. Hops, apples and other fruit are also grown but not always as a main source of income. The general attitude to the E.E.C. & its quotas is fairly positive, although admittedly the area has not been affected by quotas because of the types of farming practised.
